title: Sri Pahang FC
text:
Sri Pahang Football Club () is a <a href="Malaysia">Malaysia</a>n professional <a href="association%20football">football</a> club based in <a href="Kuantan">Kuantan</a>, <a href="Pahang">Pahang</a>. Founded in 1959 and has traditionally worn a yellow home kit since. At the beginning, club's home matches were held around the city public fields and outside <a href="Kuantan">Kuantan</a>, predominantly around districts of Pahang.
The lowest point of the club was in 2012, when KBS Sri Pahang were relegated to the <a href="Malaysia%20Premier%20League">Malaysia Premier League</a>. The club came back from the abyss to the <a href="Malaysia%20Super%20League">Malaysia Super League</a> in <a href="2013%20Pahang%20FA%20season">2013</a> after winning the play-off match against <a href="Kedah%20FA">Kedah Darul Aman</a>.
History.
Sri Pahang was established by <a href="Abu%20Bakar%20of%20Pahang">Sultan Abu Bakar</a> in 1959 to represent the state of <a href="Pahang">Pahang</a> in the HMS Beagle Cup. In the next year, the association begins with the preparation against another states before taking part for the first time in the HMS Beagle Cup. Construction of their current home ground, <a href="Darul%20Makmur%20Stadium">Darul Makmur Stadium</a>, was completed by the Council of <a href="Kuantan">Kuantan</a> in 1970.
Led by the legendary <a href="Jamal%20Nasir">Jamal Nasir</a>, Pahang FA won the first cup in 1983 when they won the Piala Malaysia, the most prestigious tournament in <a href="Malaysia">Malaysia</a> football after a win over <a href="Selangor%20FA">Selangor FA</a> in the tournament, breaking the long duopoly of Selangor FA and <a href="Singapore%20Lions">Singapore FA</a> and also became the first East Coast team to win it. Nonetheless, the most successful era was in the 1990s, when the association reached the final of <a href="Piala%20Malaysia">Piala Malaysia</a> 4 times even though they only succeeded once in 1992. 1992 was the best year when the association won the double, the Piala Malaysia and the league. Sri Pahang in that year was touted as the Dream Team when several high-profile players played for the association with the like of <a href="Dollah%20Salleh">Dollah Salleh</a>, <a href="Zainal%20Abidin%20Hassan">Zainal Abidin Hassan</a>, <a href="Ahmad%20Yusof">Ahmad Yusof</a>, <a href="Khairul%20Azman%20Mohamed">Khairul Azman Mohamed</a>, Abdul Mubin Mokhtar, Australian football legend, <a href="Alan%20Edward%20Davidson">Alan Edward Davidson</a> and Singapore football legend, <a href="Fandi%20Ahmad">Fandi Ahmad</a>. The association defeated <a href="Kedah%20FA">Kedah FA</a> in final stage to win the Piala Malaysia, thanks to the fastest goal ever in Piala Malaysia history by Zulhamizan Zakaria.
Sri Pahang was also the first winner of the M-League in its new format in <a href="2004">2004</a>.
As one of the most successful football teams in <a href="Malaysia">Malaysia</a> from 1980 to 2007, Sri Pahang had produced many talented local players from the academy such as Khairul Azman Mohamed, one of the best goalkeepers in Asia in the 1990s, the prolific striker, Azizul Kamaluddin, <a href="Mohd%20Fadzli%20Saari">Mohd Fadzli Saari</a> who played in <a href="SV%20Wehen%20Wiesbaden">SV Wehen Wiesbaden</a> in Germany and <a href="Muhammad%20Juzaili%20Samion">Muhammad Juzaili Samion</a> who also played for the 4th division of <a href="Ligue%201">Ligue 1</a> club, <a href="FCSR%20Haguenau">FCSR Haguenau</a> in <a href="2000">2000</a>.
In <a href="2008">2008</a>, many players from talented young <a href="Shahzan%20Muda%20F.C.">Shahzan Muda F.C.</a> were absorbed into Sri Pahang.
In 2012, Sri Pahang was playing in the 2nd division of M-League. While in the Premier League, Sri Pahang showed great improvement in the 2012 season as they qualified for the Piala Malaysia quarter-finals. Sri Pahang was also Premier League runner-up in 2012, qualifying the association to play in the promotion "play-off" matches to the Liga Super. Sri Pahang beat <a href="Kedah%20FA">Kedah FA</a> in the final of the "play-off", winning promotion to the <a href="2013%20Liga%20Super">2013 Liga Super</a>.
In 2012, the association had to play in <a href="Temerloh%20Mini%20Stadium">Temerloh Mini Stadium</a> as the homeground for the first time after the <a href="Darul%20Makmur%20Stadium">Darul Makmur Stadium</a> was put under renovation for the organisation of <a href="Sukma%20Games">Sukma 2012</a>. A year later, the club returned to <a href="Kuantan">Kuantan</a> to play in newly renovated Darul Makmur Stadium and in the same year the lifted the Piala Malaysia for third time. Led by loyal serving captain, <a href="Jalaluddin%20Jaafar">Jalaluddin Jaafar</a>, they ended 21 years cup drought. By winning the cup, Zainal Abidin Hassan and Dollah Salleh had cemented their status as central figures of club history, as they won it as a player and as manager and coach respectively.
Stadium.
Sri Pahang are currently based at <a href="Darul%20Makmur%20Stadium">Darul Makmur Stadium</a> in <a href="Kuantan">Kuantan</a>, <a href="Pahang">Pahang</a>. The capacity of the stadium is 40,000 and also has a running track.
Players.
First-team squad.
 
 
 
Club personnel.
Sri Pahang Football Club Sdn. Bhd. is the company which owns Sri Pahang Football Club.
